availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Nancy Moody. Father of Henry Moody and Harriet Moody. Resident of Green County, Kentucky, in 1840. Owned four enslaved persons in Green County in 1840. Farmer in Green County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Green County in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Southern Division, p. 175.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 110B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 617.
"John Moody (1791-1868)," Find A Grave, Memorial 36441163, accessed March 17, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/36441163.
